page.title: 08Batley Market Square
page.content: One of the main features of Batley market place is the library.In the entrance hall is a plaque which reads: "The library (towards the erection of which Andrew Carnegie L.L.D. generously contributed to the public Â£6,988) was formely opened to the public on 19th October 1907 by councillor W.J. Inson,Mayor." The library was then named after Carnegie. In the library there are 39,00 books and 12 people work there.Above there is an art gallery.Next door to the library there is a post office. Another of the most prominent features of the the market square is the town hall.It was opened to the public on 18th July 1905 by George Hirst Esq.,Mayor.There are two plaques either side of the entrance which says this and shows all the workmens names who built the town hall
